stimulusHtml: An electron is initially at rest, far away from other charged objects. An electromagnetic wave approaches the electron, traveling in the positive z-direction. Immediately after the wave reaches the electron, which of the following gives a possible direction of the electronâ€™s acceleration and provides evidence that supports the claim?
choicesHtml: Parallel to the x-axis. Electromagnetic waves are transverse waves.
Parallel to the x-axis. Electromagnetic waves are longitudinal waves.
Parallel to the z-axis. Electromagnetic waves are transverse waves.
